shinysense 0.1.1
  • Reference

Use shiny on your mobile phone to gather accelorameter data for whatever your heart could desire.

shinymovrUI.Rd

Use shiny on your mobile phone to gather accelorameter data for whatever your heart could desire.

shinymovrUI(id, resting_msg = "Turn On", button_width = "130px",
  button_height = "50px", button_color = "steelblue")

Arguments

id

the id you will use to keep track of this component in your app
resting_msg

the string displayed when the button is not pressed. Defaults to "Turn On"
button_width

width of the button in a valid css string. E.g. needs to have pixels appended to it.
button_height

height of the button, again in valid css string.
button_color

valid css string to control the button color.

Value

A blue button that you press to initiate or stop recording of acceloration data.

Examples

shinymovrUI('movrButton', resting_msg = 'Click me to record', button_width = '200px')
#> <button id="movrButton-movr" class="movr-button" style="background-color: steelblue; width: 200px; height:50px">Click me to record</button>

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Examples
